page.title: 19WESTBURY&DISTRICT TWINNING
page.content: The Westbury and District Twinning Association was set up as a result of a public meeting in 1977.The Association was formed from people with an interest in twinning together with members from the Council.The Association is completely independent from the Council and self funding. A link was established with Soisy sur Seine,a small town some 20 miles from Paris bounded by the Senart Forest,a favourite hunting ground of the French kings. In 1978 a delegation led by the then Chairman of the Council,Mrs.J Holloway took part in a ceremony in Soisy when the Twinning Charter was signed and the keys of Soisy were presented to the Council.In September of the same year a similar ceremony took place in Westbury attended by M.Gaston Rocher Mayor of Soisy.
